results.title: Gordon splits
results.creator_credit: Michael Cordell, Wilderness Society (Australia) and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Peter Dombrovskis, Australia’s foremost Wilderness photographer, photographs two spectacular gorges in South West Tasmania. He talks about his own experience of wilderness and the threat of flooding.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Cordell, Wilderness Society (Australia) and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative

results.title: The Ghost in the shed
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: A whimsical story of a polite but persistent ghost of a secretly buried murder victim. His attempts to draw attention to his remains mystify the family in the house. Based on the book by Marilynne K. Roach.

results.title: Do not pass go
results.creator_credit: Kent Chadwick, Victorian Film Corporation and Phil de Montingnie
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the story of two young people and their confrontation with the law. Set in the streets, in the children’s courts and in the prisons, it shows that Australian welfare systems do not necessarily assist such teenagers. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kent Chadwick, Victorian Film Corporation and Phil de Montingnie

results.title: A Puppet pudding
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, David Perry, Michael Creighton and Marionette Theatre of Australia
results.brief_description: An introduction to the world of Norman Lindsay’s classic Australian children’s story “The Magic Pudding”, using puppets from the Marionette Theatre of Australia’s stage production. Explores the background to the writing of the story and looks behind the scenes of Australia’s national puppet theatre. Concludes with characters on stage at the Sydney Opera House. Presenter: Richard Bradshaw.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tasmanian Film Corporation, David Perry, Michael Creighton and Marionette Theatre of Australia

results.title: Tasmania's south west: a wilderness in question
results.creator_credit: Damon Smith, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS

video_links.name: Tasmania's south west: a wilderness in question

results.brief_description: Designed to increase public awareness of the nature of the South West Tasmanian wilderness and the threats facing it. Concentrates on the two main threats, namely the Hydro-Electric Commission’s damming and flooding of the wild rivers of the area for power development purposes and the extensive logging of the native forests by the Forestry Commission. Explores the issues at hand by interviews with leading figures on both sides of the struggle. Narrated by Ian McGarrity.
results.title_for_label: Tasmania’s south west: a wilderness in question
results.creator_credit_for_label: Damon Smith, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS

results.title: On Paper
results.creator_credit: Ray Harris, Michael Bongiovanni, Andrew Scollo, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
The connecting link in this video is photography, and the different approaches Micky Allan, Sally Robinson, Mandy Martin and Jenny Watson have to producing works on paper using photography either directly or indirectly

results.title: Play safe
results.creator_credit: John Morris, South Australian Film Corporation, Education Dept of S A, Dennis Hill Productions and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: The fun of swimming and participating in water sports can be spoiled unless basic safety rules and techniques are known, practised and used. This comprehensive water safety film covers all aspects from drown-proofing to the use of life-jackets, to a full illustration of the Royal Life Saving Award technique of safe non-contact rescue. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
